rows.name: help_text
rows.value:
Pick a fraction to use as a special number. It could be for the day, or just for a special event. It can be a proper fraction, improer fraction, mixed number, or whole number. Students are challenged to 5 to 8 ways to make that number using addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division (sharing).

Add constraints to methods that are allowed to steer your students to ideas you want them to practice.

rows.name: topics_text
rows.value: This develops skills doing arithmetic with fractions. It also increases number sense for the fractions.

rows.name: advice_text
rows.value:
Including interesting constraints is what drives this routine. 

Here are some possible constraint examples:
* Only use unit fractions.
* Cannot use 1/2's
* Must use a whole number in at least one solution
* Must use equivalent fractions in your solution
* Must use addition (subtraction, multiplication, division) at least once
* Must include both addition and subtraction in at least one solution
* Must include at least one drawing
* Must include decimals in one or more solutions
* Must include fractions with three different denominators in each solution
